intro: Galium polyanthum, commonly known as the clustered bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It features slender, often hairy stems that form dense mats or clusters near the ground. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Galium polyanthum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows.
